- Key requirements (from project offer):

  - Nice-to-have: SAP S/4HANA Sales, SAP CPQ, Salesforce cert, BTP integration, domain experience (Energy/Real estate)

- Evidence in CV (matches):
  - Strong architecture and integration background across many enterprise platforms (Oracle OSB, WebLogic, middleware) ‚Äî relevant for integration aspects with ERP
  - Proven experience in cloud architecture, SAP BW/4HANA infrastructure design on AWS (2021) ‚Äî shows exposure to SAP landscape from an infrastructure/architecture perspective
  - Long consulting career, extensive documentation practice, fluent German, strong analytical and problem-solving track record
  - Experience with automation (Terraform, CI/CD), DevOps and complex migrations ‚Äî useful for implementation projects and technical delivery

- Gaps vs. MUST requirements:
  - No explicit hands-on experience or projects listed with SAP CX, SAP Sales Cloud or SAP Service Cloud (V1/V2)
  - No stated 3+ years of SAP CX / Sales & Service consulting experience
  - No mention of SAP S/4HANA Sales functional experience, SAP CPQ, Salesforce certification, or BTP integration expertise (all listed as important/beneficial)

- Assessment / recommendation:
  - Andreas is a very strong enterprise architect/integration & cloud engineer with consulting experience and some exposure to SAP on the infrastructure side. However he lacks the core, hands-on SAP CX (Sales & Service Cloud) implementation experience that the role explicitly requires. He could be a candidate for an integration- or cloud-architecture adjacent role on the engagement, but for a pure SAP Senior Consultant/Architect for SAP Sales & Service Cloud the fit is low‚Äìmedium.

- Fit rationale summary: given strong transferable skills (architecture, integration, SAP infra exposure, consulting, documentation) but absence of the central SAP CX implementation experience and related product knowledge, I score the fit at 30/100.
